page.title: 14WATCHING TELEVISION 1985.
page.content: We can watch television on four channels. They each broadcast for about sixteen hours every day. We surveyed the children aged 5 to 11 in our school and discovered that they watched, on average, 2.5 hours of television each week-day. The most popular channel was I.T.V. and the least popular was B.B.C.2. The types of programmes children enjoyed watching were{comedy {programmes}like Bewitched (an American programme),{soap-operas}like The Young Doctors (Australian) and Emmerdale Farm (British), and{light {entertainment programmes}like Give us a Clue, Lift Off, and The Wall Game. In our school, 64% of pupils have a video recorder and most of them belong to a video library from which they can hire video films at a cost of Â£1 to Â£1.50 per night.
